oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Squirlie and Hank Drinking
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This recording contains an interview between a severely intoxicated Hank Snow and his equally intoxicated handyman, "Squirlie" Carter. Tape is the eleventh of an unidentified number of tapes.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Hank Snow says hello to Mr. Carter -- (00:25) Snow and Carter talk about Carter being late to work -- (00:46) The two start talking about the Sons of the Pioneers -- (1:30) The two move on to the reason why they opened a bottle of home brew -- (03:19) Decide to name the home made beer Sunny Brook -- (04:02) Reminisce when and how they made their first home brew -- (06:09) Carter gets more to drink for them -- (06:26) Snow tries to figure out the date and time -- (07:15) Snow and Carter take a drink and talk about their new beers -- (08:04) Talk about fiddle players, Tommy, Chubby, and Buford -- (09:00) Figuring out how to sign off -- (09:25) Carter signs off -- (09:50) Snow turns the recorder back on -- (10:02) The two talk about where Carter has been and what he is doing now -- (10:43) Carter describes his job at Rainbow Ranch -- (11:46) Snow and Carter discuss what Carter's days look like -- (13:14) The two talk about fleas -- (14:52) Talk about a possible visitor -- (15:39) They start talking about playing pool -- (16:01) Hank and Carter try to figure out what to do for some more excitement -- (16:54) The two try to figure out a new sign off -- (17:01) Carter talks to the recorder while Snow answers the door -- (17:43) Snow comes back and talks about the refrigerator man who was at the door -- (18:30) Undistinguishable conversation -- (19:18) The two continue to try to figure out how to sign off -- (19:48) Carter and Snow sign off
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Snow, Hank;
